111.title: Spider-Man

1111.content:
Don’t you just hate jealous exs? They get clingy and jealous, wanting to either hurt you or get you back. They can do crazy things and what can you do, but try and deal with it the best you can without making it worse. Exs can be the worst, but for Peter Parker, also known as the Spectacular Spider-Man, he had the worst case of jealous ex in the world. His ex wasn’t some prissy woman, but a black symbiote suit that wouldn’t leave him alone.

The symbiote, or Venom as it called himself when various people that wanted to kill the spider were wearing it, only wanted one thing, to be back with Peter. It had been worn by him for years before being rudely pulled off. It left it bitter and a little blood thirsty for revenge, but it still wanted to be with Peter, anyway it could. It had tried hurting him for many years, using people like Eddie Brock and the first Scorpion, but it had only pushed it’s first love away. The symbiote was a simple creature and it wanted Peter, putting him in life threatening danger hadn’t worked, so it considered another approach.

Over the years, it had experienced much with its hosts, but none of them could compare to its first. His latest host was a real freak that had started eating people while wearing him. Now, the symbiote had no problem swallowing people, but his host liked to tear them apart and chew them up. That left the black suit feeling sick. Eating people was something it had always been able to do, but it only enjoyed swallowing live prey like a snake. Tearing and chewing prey came unnaturally to it and it hated doing it.

Constantly, it tried changing his host’s preference to try swallowing prey instead, but his mind was too distorted to listen. After it’s host started gnawing on squirrels like they were popcorn, the symbiote became desperate to find a better host; a more stable host.

It was ready to simply leave the crazy, maniac it was stuck to and try it’s luck with the first person that wanted a shiny black alien suit, when fate smiled on it. Spider-Man, his first and preferred host, had spotted his current host eyeing a couple of girl scouts like they were cookies and had started to fight him. Punches were thrown and words were exchanged, the symbiote wasn’t listening as it tried to come up with a way to return to Peter without being removed. It couldn’t simple hop back on Peter, it would be ripped off before it could get attached. It needed to come up with a plan not involving forcing itself or trying to kill Peter. This was a completely new idea for it.

Time was running out, its current host was losing, again. It needed to come up with something and then an idea hit it. It was time to think outside of its tiny box.

“Come on Venom, you can do better then this. By now you’re usually throwing convertibles at me,” Spider-Man joked as he crawled up the side of a building as Venom hissed at him and followed. Venom bared his long, knife like teeth at his hated enemy, wondering why he felt so weak too. It was like his suit wasn’t trying to make him stronger, like it was only trying to prolong the fight. Shaking his head, Venom realized that was stupid. His suit couldn’t think for itself.

“I’ll slaughter you Spider-Man!” Venom screamed as he joined his enemy on the rooftop. Raising his bulky arms into the air, he let out a shrill screech. He was going to pounce on the Spider, when he felt a tingling in his chest. Suddenly, a slimy black tentacle exploded out of his chest towards Spider-Man. His spider sense came too late and the tentacle slammed against his chest, leaving a black, inky smear all on his suit. The blow only pushed him back several feet. Looking down at the stain on his custom, Spider-Man looked at Venom. The tentacle was pulling back into his chest, disappearing back into the suit like it had never happened.

“What was that?” Spider-Man asked, expecting an evil laugh and explanation from his dim enemy. Venom remained silent, rubbing the spot the tentacle came out of and staring at it dumbly.

“I have no clue.” Venom looked up in time to see Spider-Man reel his fist back and deliver an uppercut to his unprotected chin. Stars filled Venom’s eyes as he was thrown back. That had hurt a lot, like his suit hadn’t cushioned the blow at all. He lost consciousness when the back of his head slammed into the hard gravel roof of the building.

“That was kind of easy,” Spider-Man said in surprise. Venom didn’t usually go down without a fight usually. Looking back down at his suit, he sighed, knowing the stain was going to be a pain to clean if he could clean it at all. If the stain was too deep, he’d have to get a new suit. “MJ is going to kill me if she has to make me a new costume again.”

Swinging off towards home, Spider-Man had no clue that his stain was no simple alien slime. The symbiote’s consciousness was inside this tiny stain, able to move and influence people however it wanted. It had left its last host with a useless black suit that would melt in hours. The symbiote was back on Spider-Man, but was going to try things differently this time.

Remaining completely lifeless, the symbiote pretended to be just a smear until Spider-Man got home and removed his uniform. Throwing his costume into the laundry for his wife to clean, Peter went to take a shower. A tiny black fluid moved away from the suit and hid itself behind a bookcase where none could see it. The first part of its plan had been realized.

Now it had to decide what it was going to do. It knew that it needed to go about things differently. Instead of attaching itself around his host, it would try the reverse; it was time for the symbiote to work from in the inside. It would enter its next host, give them an increase in strength, but instead of heightening their aggression and trying to take complete control, it would try something new. Its cannibalistic last host may have freaked the symbiote out, but it did give it some ideas. It should try to renew it’s species old ability of eating prey alive. It could change his host’s mind subtly, giving them a hunger for flesh, but also the ability to swallow prey whole. Every time its host would eat someone, it’s hold on its mind strengthened. It was the perfect way to stay close with it’s host and relive what made it a fearsome species. It was going to transform them into hungry little humans and stay with them forever.

Now, it originally planned to infect Spider-Man. He was the person it wanted to be with, but it was starting to think of another idea, one that might make it closer to Peter then if it became part of his mind. He couldn’t force Peter to love him, but Peter loved his wife Mary Jane, so therefore, if it entered Mary Jane and became a part of her, Peter would love it because it was part of Mary Jane. It was so simple that the Symbiote would smile if it wasn’t just slime.

If it became a part of Mary Jane, not only could it become closer to Spider-Man, but it would also be able to use it’s ability to devour prey whole to consume Peter. It could control its host digested, Peter could spend days inside MJ and it without any harm to him. The thought of turning Mary Jane into his next host was sounding very tempting, but it had to chose carefully. If it were found out, it would never get a second chance.
1111.title: Snatching a Spider

choices: The next morning, Mary Jane seems different to Peter
After Peter leaves in the morning, Mary Jane finds herself oddly hungry
11112.content:
“Tiger, you home?” Just as soon as it decided, the symbiote’s choice opened the door. Even when she took just a few steps into the apartment, her sexy body gave her the appearance of sauntering. Although having already made up its mind, the symbiote examined the body it would soon be living in.

As a model/actress, Mary Jane was absolutely gorgeous. Her flowing red hair shimmered in the light. Her face was so lovely and her complexion was perfect, with jade green eyes able to get anyone’s attention. Of course, most people didn’t look at her eyes first off, but who could blame them? Right now she was wearing a sleeveless top that stopped inches above her navel, and exposed a very generous amount of her cleavage. Such large breasts stretched out the fabric, and yet exposed just enough to tease, but never crossed over the line of too much. The symbiote admired her future host’s own means to attract mates, plus the top was even black. Beneath her toned stomach was tiny waist that quickly ended with her well rounded hips. Mary Jane was wearing a pair of hip hugger jeans with a matching black belt that again emphasized her curves, especially the ones she had in the rear. You could bounce a quarter off that butt. With her looks, Mary Jane could have any man she wanted, but she only had eyes for Peter Parker. The symbiote thought, she has excellent taste.

“In the shower MJ. Could you toss my costume in the wash?” Peter called out from the shower. MJ said yes and made her way to the hamper. Grabbing a hold of the Spider-Man costume wasn’t exactly new for her, but as she held the red and blue tights in her hands, Mary Jane had one of those moments that every girl who dates a superhero has. Main thought “I can’t believe I’m with a superhero!”

Making her way down to the laundry room in the building, she thought about how she should have seen this coming from the beginning. From the first time he opened his door on their blind date, she knew she was looking at a guy who was more than he seemed. She liked to tell herself that she knew all along he was Spider-Man, but honestly, even she couldn’t have known just how different Peter was. Most guys can’t keep their hands to themselves on dates, but he was the only one she knew of whose hands could also scale skyscrapers.

After Gwen was killed, Mary Jane could have easily swooped in and made Peter hers forever, but she was not that kind of person. She was there for Peter as a friend, and given all the crap he went through, he always needed a shoulder to cry on. With his sick aunt, his closest friends getting injured or dying or turning out to be super villains, and not to mention being stuck at a job who shouted as much as Hitler and had a moustache to match, MJ wouldn’t be surprised if the devil himself had it out for Peter.

Even half of those issues could scare away any potential girlfriends, but not Mary Jane, and she smiled softly as she secretly put Spider-Man’s suit in the washing machine. She loved Peter with all her heart and admired him for putting up with so much crap, and yet he still kept moving forward. He was so funny, upbeat, and was so cute when he spoke techo babble like the nerd he was, she told herself that she would always be there for her man, she had married him after all.

Later that night, the symbiote once more peeked out from behind the bookshelf. It watched as the happy couple just talked. Their smiles, their body language, all of it pointed to a very intimate relationship, which was not exactly uncommon when two people are in love. Still, it was as enticing as it was painful for the symbiote to watch. It wanted to be that close to Peter, but rather than using its anger to destroy an enemy like always, it reminded itself that was not the reason it was here, and that the closeness Mary Jane had with Peter would make its job all the more easier.

As the night continued, and as the couple got ready for bed, one of them briefly mentioned the Black Cat, and Peter pondered how a reboot would turn out for a certain movie franchise, the two finally got under the covers together, and shared a goodnight kiss. An hour later, the symbiote’s patience finally paid off as the two were fast asleep. Although anxious to get to started, it also couldn’t fathom how even for just a night those two would be satisfied with just a kiss.

It slithered its way across the floor and up onto the bed. It went up onto one of the posts connected to the headboard on Mary Jane’s side. Once above her, it looked at her sleeping peacefully in her nightie with her arms wrapped around Peter, a position they would soon share.

It was only going to get one shot with this, and thus it dripped down until it was just above her face, where a single tendril oozed out from the tiny blob and briefly poked MJ’s cheek. Like clockwork she stretched out her arms and yawned, but didn’t wakeup. This allowed the symbiote to drop right into her mouth in one fluid motion, leaving Mary Jane to simply smack her lips and turn over to her other side.

11131.content:
It was a bright, sunny, and overall noisy day within New York City. The common traffic jams of the town's daily life filled the streets at every interval. Hundreds of feet above was a figure leaping through the skies, web ejecting from his hand onto buildings and swinging him forward. The hero had a slim build, a prominently red and blue spider themed suit. He was Spider Man, the hero of New York.

It was fairly obvious what or shall I say who he was after. Some new villain had just robbed a bank and well...it wasn't hard to find him. His costume like many of the jokes Spider Man went up against was poor at best, it resembled a childs attempt to recreate an atom in the form of a costume...which it essentially was. This poor fool was known as Molecular Man, or at least that's the name he gave Spider Man as he took off running.

"Geez where do these guys come from?" Spider Man asked himself, shaking his head midswing. Molecular Man had been causing trouble all over Manhattan, doing the usual stuff for crooks; terrorizing random people, stealing from banks, fighting the cops. How he did it though Spidy had to admit it was unique. Molecular Man would shrink things, apparently through some device built inside his joke of a suit's gloves. To mess with people he would shrink them and more often than naught leave them to fend for themselves; as a result some people have been found beneath people's shoes, killed by ants, or even enslaved by some demented person. This same shrinking power is what he used to rob banks; shrink the bank, get all the money from intimidating the now miniature denizens of it, and slipping it all into something like a small sack where he would return it to normal upon returning to his lair...or at least that was the only reasoning Spider Man could come up with for shrinking the bank at the get go.

It was annoyingly hard to get leads on him; always he would either shrink himself until he's all but gone from sight or shrink away any and all who come near him. Still Spider Man along with his alter ego Peter Parker managed to piece together where he would strike next and thus Spidy waited patiently. As expected Molecular Man came and well...things pretty much ended up as they were. With no time to shrink anything Molecular Man took off with a full sized sack of cash and Spider Man was hot on his heels.

The chase had been going on for about twenty minutes and frankly Spider Man was growing impatient. " I'll just end this with a classic." Still web swinging with his right hand Spidy aimed his left hand towards the crook, hand in position to shoot web. Placing his fingers on the trigger area a stream of web came from Spider Man's wrist and went directly towards Molecular Man. The poor inexperienced criminal got him and flew to the floor, the webs holding him in place and Spider Man leapt onto the ceiling and walked towards his spider web net trapped prisoner.

With each step Peter felt his spider senses tingling; meaning danger was on its way. "I'll have to be careful." The closer he got the more disturbing things seemed to become. With every passing moment Molecular Man was cackling, and it grew worse until eventually he actually had Green Goblin beat.

Spider Man held his ground though and proceeded, only stopping when he was a couple feet away from the small time criminal. "What's so funny? You get a look at your costume somehow?"

Molecular Man shook his head, "No, no no no. It's just amazing how foolish you are."

"You'd be surprised how often I hear that." Spidy replied wittily, not phased in the least.

Again the criminal chuckled, "But you missed such an obvious thing. This Web Net of yours...." Suddenly the crook pointed his left palm covered in a black glove at the hero. "HAS HOLES!!"

Spider Man had no time to react, using on the holes in the Web Net Molecular Man blasted his through the weapon installed into his glove. The blast made contact. Everything seemed to grow dim, dark until Spider Man collapsed on the concrete ground; the annoying cackling of Molecular Man ringing in his ears.

Peter awoke dazed, everything around him blurry. Instantly he recognized the feeling of ropes along his body, although to his captor it was likely string. He was on some kind of coffee table, facing a general direction inside someone's home. His eyes locked on movement and even in his blurred vision Spidy recognized the horrible costume of Molecular Man, apparently thinking he was still unconcious Molecular Man had begun to change out of his supervillain attire.

His vision began to clear and it was then that Spider Man realized something truly shocking.....
11131.title: Itsy Bitsy Spider Man

111311.content:
His vision clearing Spider Man was shocked, Molecular Man slowlychanged out of his ridiculous outfit and as it came off Spidy noticed amazing things. His butt was firm, his breasts were far bigger than any males, and his body had a slender femine build; the "man" he had been captured by was really a woman!

The giantess chuckled to herself as she slipped out of the costume fully, clothed in common jeans and a red shirt. Kicking the villain costume aside she removed a device she wore at her throat to disguise her voice as a males, and then she stepped to the side and walked somewhere in her home. The best Spider Man caught was a glimpse of her true face but for some reason Peter felt it was oddly familiar. She seemed fully unaware of that fact her captor was asleep which was a wonderful blessing for Peter; it gave him time to work his way out of his restraints. It was surprisngly tight, as to be expected of robe but Spidy didn't become a hero from being weak; in mere moments he burst his arms through the strings that binded him and he was free.

He was still minorly light headed but as far as Peter could tell his spider senses couldn't sense any approaching danger. Looking around Spider Man looked for an escape route, but Molecular Man...er...Woman seemed to have prepared for any shrinkees escaping. Literally her home was sealed tight, no small holes, windows were shut completely, vents were sealed, it was all a surprisingly thorough set up.

"So much for her being another loser villain." Peter muttered under his breath, his intelligent mind racing for a plan of action. The house was sealed, that limited escaping considerably. In fact, it made the only means of escape either riding his captor or awaiting til she leaves and bolt for the door in the hopes it'll be open long enough for him to get through. Those were pretty much his only escape tactics but Spider Man also had to consider the villainess he was with. Almost surely she would notice he would be gone and chances were she wouldn't leave if he were missing from his prison.

" Man how I'd kill for a cell phone right now..." Suddenly it clicked, Spider Man may not have been able to leave without some form of assistance from a normal sized person but surely his captor had a phone somewhere! If he could get to it he could contact the police and hopefully they'll do their job. Still...Peter couldn't see a phone any where and well...if he moved about he'd risk getting crushed or found by whoever Molecular Man really was.

He decided it was worth the risk and with a flick of his wrist web shot out of Spider Man's hand and with the web robe he flung his way into another room.

Either through poor luck or a very bad choice the room Spidy entered was what his captor entered too. There she was, standing before a mirror checking herself out. Slightly curious Spider Man looked in the mirror and saw the giantess's beautiful face and he couldn't believe it but he knew this woman! It was.....
111311.title: Surprise Surprise

111312.content:
He was home. Peter recognized his surrounds as the apartment he shared with his wife Mary Jane. He stared at his giant home, fear growing inside of him as the full ramifications of what was happening sank in. He had been shrunk, captured and was helpless in his own home with a criminal. The only thing Spider-Man feared the most was his family getting hurt. If his wife came home, she would be in danger and there wasn’t a thing he could do to stop it. This set Spider-Man into a blind panic as he struggled against his bonds, desperate to stop this villain before he hurt his wife.

“Don’t bother Spidey. Even if you do break the floss I tied you up with, it wouldn’t matter because I’m going to be gone in a minute,” Molecule Man told him calmly as he removed his costume. Spider-Man could only see the back of the villain’s head as he shrunk his costume down and tucked it away into his pocket. He was wearing a simple pair of jeans and a shirt; nothing stood out about him that Peter could see. He struggled to get a closer look at his face, but couldn’t make it out. Lying back on his own coffee table, he decided to indulge in the criminal’s monologue. These kinds of guys loved to talk.

“How did you know where I live Molecule Man and what are you planning? If you hurt her so help me I’ll…”

Spider-Man was cut off when Molecule Man started chuckling. Something Peter had said amused the criminal as he kept his back turned to the helpless hero and collected himself before speaking again. “As for how I know where you live, that’s a secret, but as for what I’m planning, well, I’m going to go home, count my money and maybe take a nice hot bath. It’s been a long day,” he casualty said and started walking away. Spider-Man watched him go in bewilderment. He was completely at his mercy and he was just leaving him in his house, it didn’t make sense. His enemies would kill for an opportunity like this and he was letting it go, like Spider-Man didn’t matter anymore.

Spider-Man remained silent for once, not asking the burning question on his mind. If Molecule Man was just going to let him go, he wasn’t going to complain. MJ would come home and find him and everything would be okay. Size changing wasn’t anything new for super heroes. All it would take was a call to Ant-Man or the Fantastic Four and he’d have some of the super hero communities greatest minds to help him return to normal. Once he was fixed, he could hunt down Molecule Man and make sure he gets locked away. Spider-Man had nothing to worry about, or at least he thought so. Before Molecule Man left his home, he called out to Spider-Man; a final taunt that would haunt the web slinger for a very long time.

“Enjoy your new life at half an inch Spidey. Whenever I shrink something, only I can unshrink it and since I don’t do favours for insects you’re going to remain that size forever. Sure hope you have someone you trust completely to look after you because I know a lot of women find shrunken men great toys. Good luck not becoming a stain on the floor or some broad’s plaything, insect.”

The door slammed shut behind him and Spider-Man was left alone and tied up on his coffee table. He didn’t dwell to much on the last thing Molecule Man said, he had a loving wife and super hero friends that would never let him become some sort of toy to a sadistic woman. The first part did bug him because when the Molecule Man had told him he would be stuck like this forever he had sounded completely convinced.

An hour passed before the door opened again. In walked Mary Jane Parker Watson, she had been out shopping and heard about her husband’s fight with New York’s latest super criminal. The bad guy had gotten away and Spider-Man hadn’t been spotted since the fight, but Mary Jane was confident he was okay. Her Peter was a tough guy and no one beat Spider-Man. She thought about what she had gotten today and what a nice surprise Peter was in for when he got home. She thought she might try it on and give her returning hero a reward when he got home, when she spotted something small on her coffee table. Putting down her bags, she moved closer until she was staring directly at her tiny, tied up husband in his spider suit.

“Hi MJ, how was you day?” He cheerfully asked and MJ just sighed and sat down on the couch in front of him. She should be used to this after being married to a super hero for all these years.


<><><><><><><><& #62;<><><><><><><><& #62;<><><><><><><><& #62;<>


“Day fourteen of being Spider-Sized-Man,” Peter muttered to himself as he walked in circles. He was standing on his football field sized bed, wondering how things had turned out this way. Two weeks had passed since he shrunk. In the past few weeks he had spoken to everyone from Ant-Man to Dr. Strange and all of them told him the same thing, they had no clue how to fix him. It had been a frightening and stressful two weeks not only for him, but Mary Jane as well. She had been looking after him all that time, taking him to see all the super hero specialist and putting up with taking care of him. Even though he could still swing around and climb up walls, he still needed her help doing all the mundane things like keeping clean, eating and getting around the more spacious parts of their apartment that he couldn’t web through. The only thing that fit him was the spider suit he had been wearing when he shrunk and MJ was even trying to keep that clean. She had tried to keep up a happy face, but he knew it was bothering her.

That’s why she talked him into doing this. He had been unsure, but after getting a sultry smile and her assurances that it would work out fine, he crumbled, agreeing to what she wanted. He would do nearly anything for MJ and the guilt of having her take care of him made him feel terrible. Peter just hoped everything worked out all right.

“You ready, Tiger?” MJ asked from the doorway and Spider-Man looked up to stare at his giantess wife. He had seen her hundreds of times from his tiny perspective, but he never creased to be awestruck by the sight of the redheaded giantess. She was so beautiful and loving, that’s why he never gave any thought to Molecule Man’s final words. He trusted MJ with his life and knew that what happened tonight, everything would be fine.

Peter watched with affection as his wife walked into the room….

In New York City, the only thing more expensive than paying off arrest tickets was filling a coffee order. No one drove in New York; there was too much traffic. But you had options to get where you wanted to go, each one more unpleasant than the last. You could walk, where you were bumping into uninterested strangers who couldn't care less about what you have to say. You could hail a cab, provided your skin color wasn't any darker than the coffee they were drinking. The driver will never speak English, and he will be right off the boat from Nepal. Also, the driver will hate you. Your final option, and probably the worst, was the Subway. Think of about 20 people, shoved into a sardine can, and about five of those people are either pickpockets, perverts, or homeless. But even with all the crime and disdain in the city, one thing kept it standing. Your friendly, neighborhood, Spiderman!

"The Crime problem in New York is really getting serious. The other day I saw the Statue of Liberty with both hands up." Peter Parker chuckled to himself. He was currently dressed as his alter ego, the web-slinging Spiderman, and was perched atop the roof of his dayjob, "The New York Daily Bugle" where Peter was a photographer. He job wasn't that great, but he and his Aunt May needed the money, and he could get. But for all the crime in New York, the city seemed to be at a standstill today. Could my Spidey Sense be on the fritz? Peter thought to himself. I really wish I didn't have to come out here...not now anyway.

(Wavy Flashback Sequence)

"Come on Tiger...I need it."

Mary Jane Watson, Peter's best friend and wife, was lying in Peter's bed, with nothing but a thin, white bed sheet covering her. Their relationship had been going well, but Peter's secret identity put a strain on them when they wanted to get intimate. "Sorry MJ, but my Spidey Sense is going crazy right now." Peter said. "I know it sucks, but with gre--"

"I know! I know! With great power comes great responsibility!" MJ snapped. "I've heard it a million times! Why don't you go out with your pussy partner, and have a good time protecting the city!"

(End Flashback)

Man, I really fucked up. Peter thought. He was ready to turn around and apologize, but felt was startled by a pair of arms wrapping around his waist, and a large pair of breasts pressed up against his back. "What are you doing here, Black Cat?"

"Is that any way to treat a girl?" Felicia Hardy, AKA The Black Cat asked. "I thought we were partners, patrolling the city?"

"Sorry, I shouldn't have sna--" Peter stopped in the middle of a sentence. "My Spidey Sense is acting up."

Looking down, Peter saw a truck from the hazard treatment plant barreling out of control down the streets of Manhattan. Swinging into action, Spider-Man leaped from the building, and landed on the truck to see if he could help out. "Take it easy buddy! Where do you think you are driving like this, Jersey?" Unforunately, having the superhero on his car only spooked the out of control driver more, causing him so swerve and sideswipe the curb and rollover. The metal tanker of the truck ruptured, sending a Torrent of silver chemical into the street, rushing right at none other than Mary Jane Watson!

"Fuck! What's Mary Jane doing here!" Peter said, trying to save her from the oncoming liquid. Shooting a web, Spider-Man made a makeshift lasso and wrapped up the redhead, but not before her bare ankle grazed the chemical. "We'd better get you to a hospital." Peter said. Before swinging away, he checked the tanker. "Fisk Industries. Why am I not surprised?" he said, referring to the company run by the infamos criminal, Kingpin.

The hospital trip was uneventful and inclusive. The doctors ran every test, but couldn't find any sign of MJ bring hampered by chemical exposure. "C'mon Tiger, I just wanna go home." Mary Jane said to her husband, now back in his street clothes. Peter reluctantly agreed, and took Mary Jane back to their apartment before going to do some research himself about this chemical.

"Well, where are you going, Storm? I'm up for anything." said an adventurous Kitty.
"Well, Kitty, I've been wanting to go back and visit Cairo, Egypt. It feels like it's been so long since I was there, and I miss it so much" confessed a home sick Storm.

"Ahh, Kitty.She's so young, beautiful, and filled with life." admired Storm. "I guess I had better get packed, too, if I'm ever going to get to Cairo before next century." she said aloud sarcastically.

After they had finished making the necessary preparations, they both went to bed early so they could get a fresh start early the next morning.
"We'll be back in a week, Professor. Is the X-Jet ready?"
"It should be. I told Logan to fill it up with gas when he got back from Ontario last month."
"Alright then, Professor. Are you sure everything will be ok while we're gone?"
"I'm quite sure. Go, and enjoy yourselves. I'll be fine; the others will be here if I need assistance. You both deserve some rest and relaxation."
"Ok, Professor, you've convinced me."
"Take care. I look forward to seeing you both when you get back"
"Good bye, Professor!" Storm and Kitty said in unison.

And with that, they set off for Cairo.
"Mmmm, Storm, wake me when we get there. I'm still *YAWN* tired..." said a tired Kitty as she made herself comfortable.
Storm nodded her head and smiled as she focused on driving the jet.

1121322.content:
With sirens blaring and crowds of people crying out for help, the Brotherhood of Mutants had decided to make a ‘statement’ in Central Park… One that involved a great deal of property damage. Avalanche and Blob were busy tearing up the walkways and street lamps while Pyro set trees on fire, laughing it up when they scared off groups of people who scattered and panicked.

“That’s right homo-inferiors, this park belongs to the mutants.” Declared Mystique with her fist raised high, watching on in cruel mirth at the throngs of panicking people. With the place, up in flames and her heavy hitters tearing the famous park to ruins, this would be more than enough publicity for their cause.

“That’s right losers, this is our pad now.” Chuckled Toad, eyeing a fly buzzing around his greasy hair before he snapped at it with his tongue.

“Quiet Toad.” Sneered the blue skinned woman. “Why don’t you make yourself useful and scare off a few children… You’re good at that.”

“WE HAVE A BETTER IDEA!”

Looking up the Brotherhood found the shadow of the Blackbird jet hover over them, its canopy door open where Cyclops jumped off and blasted Blob’s stomach, making it warble like a Jell-O mold and forcing him to drop the lamp post he uprooted from the sidewalk. “How about you leave the exterior decorating to the professionals.” Landing behind their leader; Storm, Beast, Wolverine and Rogue stood ready to fight.

“ATTACK MY BROTHERHOOD!”

“TAKE’EM DOWN X-MEN!”

Colliding into a full-on brawl the two groups of mutants fought in the center of the park. Storm had conjured a rain storm to put out the fires, making Pyro furious as he aimed his flamethrowers at the floating weather goddess. “Bitch! You put out my fires, you’ll burn for that!” A sudden splurt from the fire nozzles let the man know his fire had gone out in more ways than one. Raising his hands up in surrender he gave sheepish smile. “Uhm… Truce?” A small lightning bolt between the legs was his answer.

Beast was making short work of Avalanche, even though the ground shook beneath his feet, a quick hurl of a piece of debris towards the man’s ankle was enough to distract his concentration, sending Avalanche spinning and cradling his bruised leg. “Dammit, why you little blue bastard, when I get my hands on…” turning around he wasn’t prepared for the right hook that knocked him out.

“Hey Hank, got a minute?”

Looking up, Beast found Wolverine diving and ducking the bloated mutant Blob from trying to crush him with the ruins of a car like some gigantic fly swatter. “Heh, gonna squish you GOOD.” Getting out of the way in the nick of time Logan rolled to stand shoulder to shoulder with the blue furred scientist. “Looks like quiet the pickle my friend, perhaps he needs a fastball special?” Nodding back, Logan curled himself into a ball while Beast easily lifted him and tossed Wolverine straight at Blob’s face. Looking up at the absurd act, Blob found an angry clawed wolverine heading straight for his face like a cannonball. The impact sent the morbidly obese strong man rolling backwards and falling onto his back with the same weight as a crashing tree, where a pair of claws pointed between his eyes. “Hey bub, wanna guess if your eyeballs are squishy too?” seeing the razor-sharp points aiming for his peepers, the Blob fainted… Right before passing wind.

“Aww JEEZ… Gonna smell that for days!”

With most of the brotherhood out of the way, Cyclops and Rogue detained Mystique on the ground, the shapeshifter having no means to struggle against Rogue’s superhuman strength. “Get off me! This isn’t over.”

“Sure it ain’t sugah, hey where’s that useless Toad of yours?” Feeling something land on her back Rogue was unprepared for the pair of hands that clasped around her eyes. “Peeka-boo, I got you!” The instant he touched her bare skin, he regretted it. Feeling a wave of dizziness, he jumped off her back, looking up to find that Rogue released Mystique but her skin had taken on a sick shade of green… His.

“TOAD!!!” Glaring back at the squat frog man, Rogue wrung her gloved hands and stared daggers at him. “Eep!” Turning, he made a break for it, running and hopping away in the hopes of escaping into the trees. “YA’LL NOT GETTING AWAY FROM ME YOU VARMENT!” Flying off into the air to pursue him Cyclops tried to call her back but found himself pre-occupied with a now free Mystique taking on the form of a bear.

Jumping from tree branch to tree branch Toad panted, trying to escape the angry southern belle making a bee-line for him. Even as far as he was he couldn’t escape her and found himself grabbed from behind and tackled to the ground. With his arms pinned to the ground, Toad was forced to look up at the angry woman pursing her lips in frustration, her green, glossy complexion showing she had taken on his powers… And she HATED it.

“H-hey, no bad feelings right Rogue? That’s a good look for you.”

Too angry to retort and getting madder by the second, Rogue did something that surprised them both. Opening her mouth wide, wider than she ever thought possible she bit down on toad’s head and began to pull him down her throat. Ignoring his struggles and muffled please she gripped his shoulders and gulped him down more and more. Snorting, Logan just smirked at the thin looking woman, wriggling the cigar between his fingers. “Heh, the fringe benefits of being me Rogue; can’t get sick and can’t get injured, perfect bill of health.”

“Oh Fuck OFF! Who do you want me to eat huh?” Grabbing hold of the bulk of her blue furry stomach she gave her bulbous middle a rough shake, baring her new sharp teeth in rage. “Who else do you want on the damn menu? Cyclops? Colossus? Maybe ah should go over to the cells and gobble up…” Mystique, the shape-shifting leader of the Brotherhood of Mutants. After the X-Men had defeated them, Xavier had them put into the dampening cells in the lower levels until they could be transported to Genosha. With her powers, she could revert herself back to her original shape, with her powers she could transform herself back to looking normal. Eagerly gambling on the possibility Rogue stomped her way out of the lab and nearly got caught on the doorframe trying to get out. Making her way down the halls she could already smell the blue woman in the large room at the next turn, licking her lips in anticipation.

Shifting through the locked door she stepped through and padded heavily past each cell, the brotherhood mutants stood in cells that made their powers inert, preventing them from escaping or causing damage. Pyro, Avalanche and Blob stood gawking at the massive furry woman like deer in the headlights. Too stunned to talk yet unable to look away, and yet with her new telepathy Rogue could hear each and every stray thought the trio could think of.

“What in the flaming hell is that?!” Blinked Pyro, not knowing if he should stare or cover his eyes at the sight of the 800-pound naked beast woman. “Did someone dye a grizzly bear blue?!”

“Damn, seeing that maybe I should lose some weight…” Sneering at the stray thought from the Blob, the bloated mutant blinked and stepped back at the she-creature’s low growl in his direction. None of that mattered right now, what DID matter was who was staring back at her in stunned surprise.

“What in the heck are you?!”

Standing in front of Mystique’s cell, Rogue took a deep breath and looked to the controls…

Typing away at the buttons with her clawed fingers, Rogue sneered when she got the combination wrong, the number pad flashing red before resetting again. She could just as easily reach through the energy barrier to pull Mystique, heck the energy COULD turn off her powers. But then again if she did how long would an 800 pound morbidly obese woman last unassisted? No, she had to eat Mystique, NEEDED to eat Mystique. If she did she’d be able to alter her shape and look normal again. The hunger was a second problem to solve but right now she made her decision and nothing was going to change it.

Looking up at the bloated furry creature licking her chops and leering at her like a prized steak, Mystique pressed herself up against the far wall of her cell, blinking in surprise of the massive blue furred fat woman getting more and more angry trying to solve the lock combo. “Grr, y’all just had to make this tricky for a gal with claws didn’t cha guys.”

“ROGUE?!”

Hearing her name, Rogue eyed the woman briefly before losing her patience and brandishing three bony claws out of her knuckles. Stabbing the controls and shutting down the energy barrier, Rogue now had nothing keeping her from gobbling up the leader of the brotherhood of mutants and she was forced to wipe a sliver of drool at the thought of it.

“Rogue what happened to you? What are you doing here? Why… Are you looking at me like that?”

“That miserable little fly gobber Toad went and gave me his powers when he touched me, and… I ATE him!”

Blinking in stunned silence, Mystique could only stand there while Rogue went on. “Then ah gobbled up Gambit, then Emma, then Wolvie and Kitty and… Ah can’t control it anymore, ahm hungry all the time, Ahm HUGE now!” Stomping heavily into the cell Rogue took up the entire door, blocking any chance of escape. “Sooner or later the rest of the gang is gonna find out, but if I had YOUR powers ah could hide of all this!” Grabbing two handfuls of her blue furry gut, Rogue gave her stomach a shake before bringing her attention back to Mystique. “Now come here!”

With her back against the wall Mystique shapeshifted her skin to become spiky and bristled with pins, raising her fists for a fight. “You want some of this? If you think you can just eat me then…” Opening her mouth wide, Rogue shot out her elongated tongue and splatted Mystique’s face, pulling her straight into her open jaws. The rest of the brotherhood panicked at the sight of the obese furry Rogue eating their leader like a frog swallowing a pinecone. Regardless of how sharp or jagged Mystique had made herself, Rogue was determined to swallow her down. When her feet passed Rogue’s lips, Mystique still had some fight left in her, struggling and thrashing in the monster woman’s insides.

“Cut it out in there you.” Huffed Rogue, parking her backside against the wall to steady herself. “If I could take down Wolverine I can take you too!” After a very long minute her ‘meal’ finally settled, leaving the metric ton woman to lean back full and immobile. Ignoring the panicked cries of the rest of the brotherhood in their cells, Rogue waited until her strength was back and then tried to use her latest powers. Looking down at her clawed, furry hand she concentrated and smiled when the blue fur and skin changed into a normal hand, granted one with pudgy fingers but it was a step in the right direction. Hoisting herself up she did the same to the rest of her, changing her body to return to its original complexion. “Ah, that’s better, now for some cloths.” Spreading her arms out her bloated nude frame shifted to include her green and white striped costume, perfectly form fitting on her 1000-pound self.
11213221113122212312.title: She decides to eat Mystique in the cellroom.

choices: The rest of the brotherhood of mutants catcher her attention.
She tries to escape, lumbering out into the school yard.
Suddenly she finds she's not alone.
112132211131222123123.content:
“And now for the part we’ve all been waiting for…”

Concentrating again she watched with almost manic glee when her massive done of a stomach began to shrink, receding back into herself like a balloon being deflated. Her fattened limbs too began to firm up, the fat just melting away. Slipping to her knees she waited until her changes were complete, a brief second’s worth lasted like a minute to her but it was worth it. Wriggling her dainty fingers and feeling the smooth complexion of her face, Rogue laughed and smiled. She looked normal again. Getting up to her feet her mind already raced on what the next part of her plan was. “OK, finally got my looks back, now to see if ah can get rid of this appetite of OOPH!” Rubbing her head, she looked up to find herself touching the ceiling, looking down she made a horrifying discovery. The whole time she wasn’t shrinking back to normal, she was growing! Keeping her head down Rogue now stood over 20 feet tall, a giantess compared to the stuffed blue furred bear woman that waddled in moments earlier. “WHAT THE FLYING FUCK?!” Willing herself to get smaller she found that when she did she got fatter as a result, her stomach and rear swelling out until she looked twice her weight when she shrank down to 15 feet tall.

“This is hopeless, what ahm I going to do now?”
112132211131222123123.title: She tries to get thinner but instead gets taller.

choices: Using all his mental power, Charles knocks her out!
1121322111312221231231.content:
“I have an idea, how about you let us go, huh?”

Looking up and sneering at Pyro’s comment from his cell, Rogue reduced her height until she was at least 10 feet tall, her bulk returned but at least she wasn’t a giantess bumping her head on the ceiling lights. “Y’all got something to say you little pyromaniac?” Bearing down and looming over the shivering red mutant in his cell, Rogue was fuming! Her desperate attempt to return to normal had blown up in her face, now with her concentration gone she had reverted to the blue furred bloated monsters she came in as. “Maybe y’all want to be next? Ah’m thinkin that maybe eating YOU might fix this WHOLE situation!”

“I think your ass is bigger than mine, and believe Me, I’ve been eating more.”

Turning her attention back at the Blob and his smug comment, something inside her just snapped. Punching the control panel to Pyro’s cell, the nullification field dropped and the cell door unlocked. Faster than the man could react, Pyro was snatched up with a single blue claw and shoved into Rogue’s open mouth with the same lack of ceremony as eating a hotdog.

“OK! I’m sorry, I take it back, you’re ACTUALLY rather slim… Heh, yeah, NOT fat at all.” Sweating like a pig in the sun, Fred dukes could only watch and slowly back up in his cell when Rogue stomped over to Quake’s cell and did the same to him, practically ripping the cell door off its hinges and nearly swallowing the screaming man whole, then stomp over to Mastermind’s cell and gobble her up. Turning her attention back to Blob, Rogue wiped her fanged blue lips and glared at the fat man cowering at the back of his prison cell.

Uhm… I have to warn you, I’m full of bad cholesterol, I don’t taste good either, I’ve had complaints, LOTS of complaints, just please don’t.” Grabbing the door with one claw, Rogue crumpled the steel like it was soft tin and tossed it over her shoulder. With the nullification field down, the Blob could feel his powers instantly return. With a regained smugness, he stood his ground and stamped his feet to lock himself in place. “Alright FATTY, whatcha got that can move the immovable blob?!” He was prepared for just about anything, a sticky tongue shooting out of her mouth like a bull whip and splatting onto his face wasn’t one of them. “Hmmphmmmmphmmm hmmm mmmm!” Desperately trying to pry the thing off his face so he could breath, he never had a chance when Rogue gripped his shoulders and opened her mouth wider than her shoulders, engulfing the man’s head and slowly inch her way down, until there was enough of him already past her throat that she leaned back and slurped down his black boots. Staggering back and falling down onto her rear, Rogue had practically doubled her mass. Rubbing her swollen stomach and belching out a red glove, the massive monster woman sighed and sulked now that her rage had ebbed away.

“Serves you right for that, you slimy varmint.”

As she waited out the Brotherhood of Mutants digesting in her stomach, she could already feel their combined powers merge with her now large collection of abilities. Snapping her clawed fingers, she created a spark that flickered at the tip of her claw before she snuffed it out. Pressing her palm on the ground she closed her eyes and caused the ground to shake, making the concrete crack before she stopped. Slumping down to rest on her back, Rogue wondered just WHAT she was going to do now? She was huge!

“Maybe ah should come clean, let the professor know what happen to me.”

“Yes! Perhaps you should!” Eyes going wide, Rogue sat up to find the professor sitting at the entrance to the small holding room, looking up at the new two tonne monster woman that had just finished eating five people. “I thought I felt the minds of the Brotherhood of Mutants going into a mad panic… Something about a big blue bear woman wanting to eat them.

Sitting up to rest on her knees and crying into her clawed hands, she tried to explain her ordeal. “Ah couldn’t control mah self, I gobbled up Toad by accident and after that ah ate Remy, then Emma, then… Ah can’t control it!”

“We’ll see if we can have you contained until your current state can be resolved, I can’t forgive what you’ve done but at least you have my word that I will try to help you.” Watching the giant furry woman wipe the tears from her eyes and regain her composure, the wheelchaired bound man was about to contact the rest of his X-Men telepathically when he heard Rogue speak up.

“You always had a way of keeping control professor, even now anyone else would have lost it or freaked out.” Standing up to stand almost 15 feet tall, Rogue towered over the man and most of the room she was in, the bulk of her meal still sat heavily in her stomach and her curves and mass were already expanding, taking in her rapidly digesting meal. “If ah had your control ah wouldn’t be in this situation…”

“Rogue.”

“If ah had your control… This hunger would be wrapped around mah little finger.”

“Anne Marie!”

Licking her lips, Rogue eyed the professor in a new light, her appetite suddenly coming back.
1121322111312221231231.title: The rest of the brotherhood of mutants catcher ...

choices: Rogue catchers up to the professor.
Xavier keeps her distracted while the school makes their escape.
Other X-Men try to stop the rampaging Rogue.
11213221113122212312312.content:
Staring up at the massive blue beast woman, practically drooling and slowly inching her way towards him, the professor didn’t need to wonder what Rogue had in mind. Darting his eyes to the control panel at the right arm of his wheel chair, he turned a nob at the speed controls. Going from ‘causally slow’, ‘quick’, ‘bathroom emergency’ to Nascar!’. With a squeal of rubber and smoke coming from his wheels, Xavier’s chair spun a full 180 degrees right around and practically flew out the door, just when Rogue landed like a tonne of bricks and crashed to the ground after trying to pounce on the man.

“C’mere you wily morsel you!”

“Stop this Rogue, this isn’t you, it’s the hunger.” Speeding down the hallway, Xavier made a bee line for the elevator, looking over his shoulder to hear Rogue’s stomping foot falls before seeing her barrel her way towards him like a rampaging grizzly bear. Leaning hard into a turn, the professor pulled to the left just when he reached the elevator entrance, tricking the massive woman into colliding into the steel doors while he floored it towards the stair case at the end of the hall he now sped through.

“You can’t lose me Sugah! If ah can gobble up ol slippery Toad ah can eat you too!”

Shoving the crumpled metal doors out of her way, Rogue fell to all fours and ran down the hall, chasing the Professor with added vigor. Drooling slightly from her blackened lips, she could already taste his iron willpower and how it would finally put an end to this gnawing hunger in her gullet, and with him nearing the stairs leading back up, she thought she finally had him cornered. That is until he spun his chair back around and pulled it into reverse. Once the large wheels hit the steps at full speed, he bounced and rolled up the flight of steps, leaning into the turn to keep his speed when he hit a corner. Looking down his eyes narrowed when he noticed Rogue phase through the narrow doorway, swiping her hands up to reach him. With no time to waste, Charles reached out with his telepathy and contacted the entire school.

“My X-Men, Rogue has gone mad and is on a rampage through the lower levels, I will distract her while you lead the students to the Black Bird and make your escape!”

Hearing the Professor’s telepathic command, Angel and Night Crawler had paused briefly, taken back by what they heard.

“Rogue? Really?” Scratching his head, Warren looked to Kurt who had the same confused look on his face.

“Da… I heard she wasn’t feeling well, but really?”

Crashing through the staircase doorway at top speed, the two mutant teachers stood in stunned silence when their professor flew by with wheels spinning before landing with a peel of rubber and skidding down the hall. A split second later Rogue tore down the door frame and fell to the ground near the pair, slamming her clawed fists on the wood floor with the force to splinter it. Blinking back in shock, the two barely recognized the woman. Easily five times her original size and ten times the weight, she was nude except for a sheen of blue fur that covered her entire body, with blue skin, pointed ears and red and yellow eyes. The only REAL mark they recognized was the stripe of white in her blue hair. “Y’ALL THINK YOU CAN OUTRUN ME? THINK AGAIN!”

“Rogue?!”

Snapping her attention to the two mutants, Kurt and Warren stepped back when they caught the look of mad hunger in her eyes. “Ahm too heavy… But y’all are light on YOUR feet aren’tcha?” Leering deeper into their eyes, Angel and Nightcrawler were stunned still thanks to her new telepathy powers. Grabbing them both in her hands she opened her mouth wide and gulped them both down whole. Standing to her feet, rogue patted her stomach and waited for their powers to be added to hers. With a shudder, Rogue felt her legs shift, her heels stretching longer, giving her a digigraded stance. A barbed tail sprouted above her blue furred rear, becoming half as thick as her arm but was over ten feet long. Rolling her shoulders, she felt a pair of feathery wings grow from her back, stretching and fluttering blue and white feathered wings that stretched out to reach either side of the hallway before folding back behind her. She didn’t need the wings, she could already fly, but Warren had strong hollow bones. “That’s better, light as a feather.” Sniffing the air, Rogue licked her chops and disappeared with a puff of black smoke.
11213221113122212312312.title: The professor makes his escape!

choices: She gets his willpower and her telepathy gets a boost.
Her telepathy gets stronger... but so does her hunger!
112132211131222123123121.content:
Bursting out the main doors of his school at high speed, Charles looked over his shoulder to find his pursuer missing, along with two of his X-Men. Bouncing down the steps and trailing smoke behind him when he hit the dirt path to the gates, he reached out with his mind and felt relief that his students and remaining X-Men had gotten to the Black Bird like he commanded and were making their way out the cliffside runway to safety.

He never had a chance to hit the breaks when a plume of purple smoke exploded right in front of him just in front of the decorative iron gates. “GOTCHA!” A blue furred claw lunged out of the smoke and caught Xavier, plucking him out of his speeding wheel chair and hoisting him up several feet in the air. Fluttering her wings to disperse the sulphurous smog, Rogue drooled at the flailing professor in her grip. Punching fruitlessly against her claws and trying to reach into her mind to force her to release him. Rogue raised her other hand and wagged her finger at the man, barring her fangs in a toothy grin. “Nuh-uh Charlie, you’re not the only psychic anymore.”

“ROGUE! PLEASE! You have to stop this now, look at what you’ve done already!”

Taken back, Rogue whimpered at the man, closing her eyes and gripping her chest with her free hand. “Ah WANT to stop this Professor, but ah can’t, ah’ve only gotten hungrier and hungrier the more ah’ve eaten… But if ah had your will power than ah can finally control this hunger o mine.” Smiling at the man, a thought came to her mind. “Ooh, might as well fix all this extra baggage.” She pointed, grabbing a handful of her furry belly and giving it a shake. Closing her eyes, she used her new shapeshifting powers to use her mass and make herself thin again. Pulling her bulk inward she stretched and grew taller, regaining her previous trim figure but now towering over 25 feet tall. Shifting her digigraded feet and sighing that she now had the room to stretch and appreciate her old figure, only now she looked like some blue anthropomorphic cat woman with feathered wings.

“Ahm gonna fix the rest of me when ah get the chance, but for now…” Licking her lips and smiling at the professor in her hand, now the size of a football compared to her. She stretched opened her mouth wide and tossed him down her throat, clamping her jaws down and slurping him down. His mass bulged down her neck before slumping down into her stomach, giving her a slight paunch. Patting her stomach, she burped at the rather meek meal she made of the man.

Closing her eyes, she waited impatiently for the professor’s powers to be added to her own, she was already getting all of his memories in a rush just like when she ate Nightcrawler and Angel.
112132211131222123123121.title: Rogue catchers up to the professor.

choices: She attacks the Blackbird, eating the remaining X-men.
She uses her telepathy, summoning animals from the woods.
she teleports to somewhere else to eat.
1121322111312221231231212.content:
Standing still, she waited patiently for his powers to become hers. With a gasp she finally got it, she felt her mind reach out, feeling every mind for miles all around. When she absorbed Emma Frost’s telepathy she could just read whomever was nearby. With Charles’s telepathy boosting it, she felt everything. Every bird and squirrel in the trees, the pair of deer grazing half a mile down in the woods… And the rest of the X-Men making their escape in the Black Bird. She could feel Cyclopes at the controls, planning a heading to Genosha. In the back hold, she felt the minds of the rest of the students, each sharing feelings of confusion and fear. The others were onboard as well; Storm, Wolfsbane, X-23, Ice-Man and Colossus all sat in the cockpit, looking back at the mansion and the blue furred monster they were escaping from.

She didn’t blame them for running away, if anything eating half the staff and principle of the school was a sure way to burn any bridges you had with the X-Men. But at least now she had control of her gnawing hunger. “Maybe in time when all this has blown over ah can go to Genosha to get ol fixed up.” Looking down at herself, Rogue had to shake her head at how far she took her uncontrollable hunger, tossing her blue hair over her shoulder where it fell between her folded wings. “Ah am a mess! This is worse than when ah borrowed the team’s powers all at once… Then again ah didn’t eat them at the ti-“

A loud growl roared out from Rogue’s middle, making her clutch at her soft furry stomach in surprise, then an emptiness gripped her, the same gnawing painful need that led her down this path, only now it was stronger.

“MOTHER FUCKER!”

Even with Xavier’s willpower, Rogue’s hunger was raging away in her belly, demanding to be filled, and now that she had made herself slim despite her towering size, she was hungrier than ever. “So… Hungry… What can ah…” If Xavier gave her anything, it was more options. Her expanded telepathy felt dozens if not hundreds of lives she could gobble up, but the biggest meal that could sate her was currently flying off into the distance. Caught between sparing her former friends and finishing them off, Rogue fell to her knees, biting her lips at the dilemma.

Another stomach growl gripped her and she made her decision.
1121322111312221231231212.title: Her telepathy gets stronger... but so does her ...

choices: She wakes up taller, nearly twice her size.
She wakes up fatter, having digested all the X-Men.
11213221113122212312312121.content:
“Holy CRAP! Look at the size of her!” Blinked Ice-man, looking out the cockpit window down at the front lawn of the mansion, still stunned at what Rogue had turned into.

Storm sharing his side of the window, shook her head in disbelief herself. “What are we going to do Cyclops?” Looking towards the leader of what remained of the X-Men, Scott replied after hitting the afterburner and flying off at supersonic speed. “We need to get to Genosha, I don’t know what’s gotten into Rogue but right now she’s gone mad and with the powers of the Brotherhood and half our team inside of her, she’s now the most dangerous person in the world!”

“Genosha? Do you really think Magneto is going to let us in? After what just happened to his Brotherhood of Mutants? To Xavier?” Laura had a point. If the X-Men and its school campus just showed up at Magneto’s front door after being told his team and best friend were gone…

“It’s either that or go to another mutant-friendly community that’ll take us in… Know of any others off hand?”

“Uhm… Guys? She’s chasing us.”

Looking out the window, the rest of the X-Men noticed that Rogue had taken to the air, flapping her blue feathered wings and flying towards them as fast as she could. “Can she actually reach us?”

Prepping the weapons just in case, Cyclops kept the Blackbird’s speed at maximum. “I’ve never seen her go supersonic, and she didn’t… Eat anyone else who could.” With weapons armed he kept his eyes ahead and the screen showing the aft camera feed behind the jet, where a dwindling image of Rogue failing to catch up grew smaller and smaller. “If we keep this up she won’t be able to catch up.” Just then the image of Rogue disappeared with a puff of purple smoke, followed by a brief explosion right on top of the Blackbird where large claws dug deep into the metal hull of the jet. Alarms squealed while Rogue kept a death grip on the side of the Blackbird, breathing in the thin air, the blue furred monster woman engulphed the front end of the jet with intense flame, blackening the tempered glass of the cockpit while she tried to tear it open.

“SHE CAN BREATHE FUCKING FIRE?!”

Thinking fast, Storm’s eyes went white, static forming all around her while outside, the clouds instantly became dark and heavy, rumbling with deep thunder. A bolt of lightning struck Rogue in the back, stunning the giant monster and making her let go of the Blackbird. The holes caused by her claws compromised the cabin pressure before Ice-Man sealed them up with intense cold, covering them in ice. “That’s not going stop her for too long.”

Looking out the other side of the cockpit, Colossus saw the falling form of Rogue right herself in the air, her feathered wings giving a flap to steady herself before she disappeared again with a puff of smoke. “She’s gone!”

Looking around through every window, the X-Men couldn’t spot her, even after Storm cleared the skies Rogue was nowhere in sight. “Where’d she fly off to?” As if to answer Cyclops, an explosion of purple smoke popped just a mile in front of the blackbird, with Rogue barrelling towards them at top speed and her mouth wide open, like a shark lunging to take a bite. “FIRING ROCKETS!” Two supersonic missiles shot out and sped towards the open mouth of Rogue, only to pass right through her like she was air. Realising too late, Cyclops never made the turn fast enough when Rogue went straight through the Blackbird, phasing straight through its hull… And swallowing everyone inside whole!

Disappearing into another puff of smoke, Rogue reappeared right in front of the Xavier mansion where off in the distance the tiny silhouette of the Blackbird fell out of the sky with no one at the controls. Cradling a bloated stomach that churned and groaned, Rogue huffed, staggering back until she collapsed against the mansion wall and slid down to the ground. Her stomach took up more space than the rest of her body! A tightly stuffed blue orb filled with dozens of struggling mutants, their punchers and kicks growing more feint until it finally went still.

“finally… Ahm full… BUUUUURP!”
11213221113122212312312121.title: She attacks the Blackbird, eating the remaining...

choices: She heads to Genosha to see Magneto.
She looks for Mr. Sinister and his Mauraders.
she goes to the High Evolutionary.
112132211131222123123121213.content:
Fluttering her eyes open, Rogue lolled her head slowly back and forth before stretching her arms out. The morning sun’s rays were cutting through the clouds and hit her eyes, forcing her awake. “Hmmm… What a dream! Thought ah went and ate…” Before she could finish that thought out loud, her hand brushed against something wooden and splintered. Sitting up, she looked like she had fallen onto a doll house, caving in its roof and crushing everything inside. “Oh no…” Getting up off the ground and staggering away from the ruined mansion, Rogue took a good look at herself and gasped. Easily forty feet tall, her formerly slim figure was gone again, now sporting thick curves that had distributed evenly over her now ten-ton mass. Her hips were now wider than her shoulders, with solid, powerful thigh muscles and a cushioned rear that stood out behind her like a shelf. Her breasts were now massive, if she were still human sized, she swore they were now G-cups, but at her current state they were the size of small cars. Firm and round, they stood proudly from her naked chest, resting slightly on the paunch of her soft belly.

But those weren’t the only changes.

Looking over her shoulder, she found that her long tail, once ten feet long had nearly tripled in length and quadrupled in girth. Now as thick as one of her legs, it swished back and forth like a cat’s tail, it’s tip now sporting a plume of feathers that matched her wings. Speaking of her wings, they now had some colour to go with the blue and white they previously had. Looking at their surface under the right light, Rogue noticed different metallic colours shimmer over each feather. “Guess ah got some of Pixie in me now.” Looking up the length of her thick tail, she noticed spikes jutting up its length. Tracing the bony growths, she found they went all the way up her spine, gasping when her clawed hand felt up the back of her neck and bumped into a pair of horns that grew out from her scalp. Surprised, she felt up her new horns. Gnarled and curved, they grew out just above her eyebrows and twisted into ‘S’ shapes at either side, making her head look like a pitchfork. “Guess that’s from Marrow…” she hadn’t noticed it before but her neck was longer, almost half as long as her arm. She was so caught up with her other changes, she didn’t notice.

Feeling over the rest of her body for anything else that was new, she finished by checking her face and found that even that had changed. The sharp teeth and feline nose wasn’t too new for her, she knew she got those from Beast, along with the blue fur and pointed ears. But now her face had pushed forward somewhat. Looking around she spotted the outdoor pool and brushed aside what little debris was floating over the water to get a better look at herself. Blinking back at her reflection, Rogue was looking back at the face of a blue furred werewolf! A werewolf sporting S shaped horns the size of car bumpers and pitch-black eyes with red, yellow and blue irises. “And ah guess that’s Wolfsbane for good measure… Perfect.” Narrowing her eyes at her watery reflection, she was caught off guard when concussive blasts shot out of her eyes, shooting straight through the water and burning a hole into the pool where swimming water funneled down to flood one of the rooms underneath it.

Blinking to turn off Cyclop’s powers, Rogue frowned at what she had become. In the span of 24 hours, she had gobbled up the entire Xavier campus and turned into a big, fat, chimera woman!

“Okay girl… How are ya’ll gonna fix this mess?”
112132211131222123123121213.title: She changes again, becoming monstrous.

choices: Mr. Sinsiter calls his Marauders to attack!
1121322111312221231231212132.content:
Stepping away from the ruins of the mansion, Rogue grimaced at how her new size and mass caused the nearby shrubbery to rattle with each heavy foot fall, how her thighs rubbed together uncomfortably and how her bust and rear swayed to each step. Putting a claw to her broad hip, Rogue considered pulling her mass back in on herself to become slim again, sure she’d probably grow taller but at least she wouldn’t look or feel so damn… bloated. Using her shapeshifting powers, she began to pull her mass back into herself, growing taller but becoming thinner as a result. But when she grew a meter taller, she stopped, a spike of hunger jabbed into her guts, making her nearly fall to her knees and clutch at her middle. Wild eyed and hungry, she searched out with her telepathy and disappeared from the campus with a puff of purple smoke.

A split second later, a cloud of smoke exploded right on top of a field of horses, spooking the animals into a panic and fleeing from the giant blue monster that literally came out of nowhere. Licking her lips, Rogue chased the herd and snatched up the slowest horse in mid run and hoisted it up with just one claw. Stretching her mouth wide like a snake and shoving the neighing animal down her maw, she forced it down her throat and gobbling it whole. Sitting down heavily on the hill she appeared on and rubbing her full belly, Rogue sighed and burped. Letting loose a small plume of fire doing so. “Mmmm… That was good…” When the hunger died off, Marie looked around and found herself in the middle of nowhere. Off in the distance she could see a herd of horses run for their lives away from her, along with stable house where she spotted the farmer run to his phone after seeing a giant blue furry beast woman eat one of his horses. “Uhm… Oops.”

With another burst of smoke, Rogue returned to the Xavier Institute, rubbing her full stomach and pacing anxiously. “OK, so if ahm plump and full, ah won’t go off and eat whatever crawls… Or runs… Or TALKS!” Nervous and worried, Rogue tried to think of what to do, who to go for help. There had to be someone that could reverse what she’s become, otherwise she’d become an ever-growing problem. Worse? Someone ELSE’s growing problem!

Closing her eyes and concentrating her mind, she used her telepathy to seek out who could best solve her personal dilemma. Far across the Atlantic Ocean she spotted the crescent island of Genosha off the coast of Madagascar. The X-Men WERE planning on flying there to escape her, she even thought about going there herself… But then again. “Magneto.” She couldn’t look into his mind, but she knew where he was and if he learned that she gobbled up Xavier and pretty much his entire school, he’d probably try to kill her! “Nu uh… Next.”

Looking further north, she peered inside the mutant research facility at Muir island, run by Moira MacTaggert. She was the leading head of research in mutation and mutant abilities in the world, housing some of the most powerful or unstable mutants known to man. If anyone could fix her powers it could be her. But then again if she learned that Rogue ate her Ex and smashed his home to bits, she might try to put her down like a rabid dog. WORSE! Set loose some of her ‘patients’ on her. “Maybe ah need someone who won’t be mad at li lol me.” Searching further and further over the globe, her fanged lips turned to a smile when she found who she was looking for.

“Bingo!” With an explosion of purple smoke, Rogue disappeared from the school ruins.

*

Deep in the amazon jungles, far from human interference and prying eyes. Mr. Sinister lounged in his chair, sipping from a glass of wine and going over the local news papers. The latest news was a string of disappearances in Rio; homeless and single living people had been dropping out of sight for the last few weeks, with no evidence of break in OR ransom. Smiling at his Marauder’s work in getting him new test subjects to work with, Sinister took a sip from his glass, only to through it away in shock when an explosion of purple smoke erupted in his main dining hall. “WHAT THE HELL?!” When the smoke dissipated, Sinister nearly leaned so back in his chair he just about fell back. Wafting the smoke out of her way with one of her wings, Rogue stood up and growled when her head hit a chandelier. Prying the thing off its hook from the ceiling and tossing it aside, Marie looked down to see the shocked face of the man she was looking for.

“Y’all are hard to find, but ah reckon you WANT it that way.”

Forcing herself to hunch down, Rogue felt cramped in the space she teleported in. Her tail was knocking over suits of armor at the door behind her and she was pretty sure she just destroyed a table and eight dining chairs under her clawed feet and hands.

“Who ARE you? And how DARE you enter my secret lair!” Getting up from his chair, he tried to call for his Marauders when Rogue took a deep breath and blew intense cold at him, slamming him against the far wall and freezing him in place. Struggling to get free, Sinister looked up to find the blue furred… Dragon woman looming over him, her black multicolored eyes staring deep into his red ones.

“Here’s the deal Sinny, ah’ve got a BIG problem and right now YOU are the only one who can fix it!”

Finally recognizing the creature’s voice, the immortal scientist blinked in shock. “ROGUE?! Who… How…”

“None of that matters now Sinister, here’s what ah want. YOU are gonna make me normal again and you are gonna do it pronto!”

Getting a better look at the woman, he could already surmise that she possessed most if not all her comrade’s powers and abilities. But how she became so huge was still a mystery, he was intrigued. “And what if I refuse then Rogue?” Getting a toothy smirk in return, Rogue leaned in closer to whisper in his ear. “Cuz in a bit ah’m going to be hungry… And y’all don’t wanna be near me when ah’m hungry!”

112211.content:
Dr.Henry McCoy was in his lab, as usual, messing around with an interesting compound someone had picked up during their last mission to the Savage Land. The initial findings were quite promising -- at first glance, it looked like the stuff was responsible for the noted gigantism that most of the flora and fauna had demonstrated there. Just to be sure, he had diluted a bit of it into a plant's food some weeks ago, and the effects were astonishing. Compared to the normal growth rate of its species, the plant was expanding over 200% faster. An injection into one of his lab rats (he named him "Mickey") was similarly surprising. The rat grew over five times the size of his littermates in the span of a few days.

He wasn't quite sure what the ramifications for this was, and he was a long way from determining the effect on human physiology -- or mutant, for that matter. Nonetheless, it was quite exciting work, a welcome respite from the long list of threats to mutantkind or emergency situations he found himself occupied with.

After carefully mapping its genetic make-up, cataloguing its properties and making sure that his initial test results were duplicated and explained, he felt ready to take his research to the next level. And, since it was highly unlikely he would get funding from a government agency, educational institution or foreign power, he would have to be ready to blaze the scientific trail himself.

He made sure that the serum he made from the compound was diluted enough. He was already quite a large man; at over six feet and four hundred pounds of hulking feline might, he was nothing to sneeze at. He wasn't the biggest or heaviest mutant on the team, but it was safe to say he was larger than average. A few more inches, a couple dozen more pounds, would hardly be noticed, he was sure.

Making sure he had the right amount of serum was more difficult than he thought it would be. The brutish paws he acquired during his last mutation made the delicate work science often demanded of him a bit of a chore. Still, he thought he had extracted little enough (merely 10 ccs of the stuff) that his growth would be measurable, but not overwhelming.

The enormous blue cat-like mutant rolled up the sleeve of his lab coat, parted some of his fur to find a vein, and pressed the tip of the needle against it. "Well, Henry," he chuckled to himself. "One small prick for mutants, one giant leap for mutantkind." He pressed in the needle's plunger and sank in the serum. There was a bit of warmth as it entered his bloodstream, but little more than that.

He sat down in front of his computer and began working on a particularly challenging physics problem he had hoped to crack a few weeks ago, letting the chair underneath him creak in protest under his weight. "Now we play the waiting game."

“I want to welcome you personally to the Xavier Institute for Higher Learning where we will help you better control your mutant powers and use them in a world that fears and hates us to build a peaceful relationship between mutant and mankind.”

Jason smiled meekly at Charles Xavier, a man known throughout the world for his work for mutants; just being in his presence was humbling for this young teenager who until a month ago didn’t even know he carried the X-gene. He just woke up one day and his mutant powers activated and everything changed, now he was in the X-Mansion talking to Professor X himself, it was like a dream come true. Jason wasn’t like those bigoted morons who thought mutants were all evil or the religious fanatics who preached that they were demons, he thought the X-Men were pretty cool. He had posters of Wolverine and Cyclopes on his wall back home as well as a very revealing picture of Jean Grey in a battle torn costume tucked away in his sock drawer. Instead of getting cool powers like energy projection or flight, he got the ability to be stuck at three inches tall. Reduced to the size of a large insect, he knew he wasn’t going to be saving the world anytime soon with the rest of the X-Men.

“Now Jason, every mutant power can be a gift if you use it right and yours comes with several abilities besides your current small stature,” Xavier remarked. Jason winced, remembering exactly what those other abilities were. His body was nearly indestructible, when enough pressure was applied, his body would become pliable and able to mold into different shapes, an ability that had saved his life quite a few times when some people had accidentally sat on him, but nothing too useable. The second ability he had made his shrunken life a real nightmare.

“I’ve asked one my X-Men to show you around and help you get settled in. I know that it can’t be easy to get around at your size.” Jason nodded his head, he had been stuck under shoes like a piece of gum enough times to learn that there is nothing wrong with having someone carry you around. He was still getting used to living in a world where he could be pinned down by someone’s thumb, but he was dealing. When the door opened, he thought things just might be looking up for him.

She was a few years older then him, it was hard to tell the age of a woman when she stands several hundred feet taller then you.
